title: (Pwn2Own) NETGEAR R7800 udchpd DHCP_REQUEST Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of NETGEAR R7800. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the handling of the vendor_specific DHCP opcode. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: NETGEAR has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://kb.netgear.com/000062883/Security-Advisory-for-Multiple-Vulnerabilities-on-Some-Routers-Satellites-and-Extenders
timeline:
2020-11-05 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2021-02-24 - Coordinated public release of advisory
